ud1.3:1.2: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the root of the tree of awakening on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.
ud1.3:1.3: There the Buddha sat cross-legged for seven days without moving, experiencing the bliss of freedom.
ud1.3:1.4: Then, in the last part of the night, the Buddha reflected on dependent origination in forward and reverse order:
ud1.3:2.1: “When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
ud1.3:2.3: When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
ud1.3:2.6: Ignorance is a condition for choices.
ud1.3:2.7: Choices are a condition for consciousness.
ud1.3:2.8: Consciousness is a condition for name and form.
ud1.3:2.9: Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields.
ud1.3:2.10: The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
ud1.3:2.11: Contact is a condition for feeling.
ud1.3:2.12: Feeling is a condition for craving.
ud1.3:2.13: Craving is a condition for grasping.
ud1.3:2.14: Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
